The Nashville Engineering team is charged with building our next generation organizer app, and the APIs and services that power it. We perform weekly demos of the code we ship, hone our skills through code reviews, and tell the world about it on Eventbrite's Engineering Blog. We believe in the value of community and the power of live experiences, and regularly host free events with top technical speakers. Learn more about the team from some of our engineers here.\n\n   THE CHALLENGE\n   We are committed to building an amazing user experience that both looks and feels great, and that we're shipping the highest quality apps possible. Our organizer apps power businesses of all sizes, from smaller conferences to massive international food, film, and music festivals. Their performance is critical; we must have a high level of confidence around every release and know that it will perform perfectly to guarantee a seamless experience for any Eventbrite powered event.\n\n   THE ROLE\n   As a Mobile Software Engineer you will collaborate with product, design and other engineers to formulate and implement solutions to various needs and requirements. We work in an iterative fashion to always have a shippable product that can instantly add incremental value to our users. We value code quality and high confidence around our releases.\n\n   THE TECH STACK\n   We primarily use Swift to build our iOS apps paired with a mix of InterfaceBuilder and Programmatic Layouts to share eye candy to our users. We leverage and contribute back to open source projects as a standard part of our development practices. We also try to build things in a reusable and maintainable way by default.\n\nTHE SKILL SET\n\n     * Experience in software design and development\n     * Experience with Objective-C, Cocoa Touch, and the iPhone/iPad SDK\n     * Experience building applications that talk to RESTful web services\n     * Understanding of software design patterns and architectural principles\n     * Strong object-oriented programming and design skills\n     * Experience writing multi-threaded, asynchronous code\n     * Database experience using CoreData, SQLite or equivalent\n     * Attention to quality through unit tests, automation scripts, and code reviews\n     * Good communicator and team player with strong organizational skills\n\nBONUS POINTS\n\n     * Experience with Cocoa on the desktop, AppKit, etc.\n     * Experience shipping one or more native iOS apps to the App Store and/or Android apps to the Android Market\n     * Experience using Python in a production environment\n     * Active contributor to open source software\n\n   ABOUT EVENTBRITE\n   Eventbrite powers ticketing and registration for more than two million live experiences each year, hosting the world's largest online selection of events. We build technology that allows anyone to create, share, find and attend events of all kinds. Music festivals, marathons, conferences, hackathons, political rallies, fundraisers, gaming competitions-- you name it, we power it.\n\n   IS THIS ROLE NOT AN EXACT FIT?\n   Sign up to keep in touch and we'll let you know when we have new positions on our team.\n\n   Eventbrite is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer supporting workforce diversity. Our background as a team is building these models for the Fortune 50 and we want to democratize and open up that technology to everyone.\n\n   The ideal candidate has a background in math, statistics and computer engineering and has worked from statistical distributions all the way to a trained and tested model. We use a wide variety of data mining and machine learning algorithms including regressions, decision trees, k-means clustering and neural nets. The right candidate will have deep experience with at least some of these machine learning techniques.\n\n   Our goal is always to match the right assumptions and models to the right problem -- they don't necessarily have to be complex. You should have experience building models that are used by people to make better decisions, we're focused on shipping early and often. We prefer iterative solutions that are incrementally better to the perfect solution. You should also be able to measure and know what impact your models had on the decisions people made -- e.g. did they outperform the previous best model or a human decision maker?\n\n   Our customers have large and varied data sets, you should have experience working with data at scale and with data sets that are sparse, incomplete and may require normalization. You'll work side by side with our analytics and data teams, which are responsible for storing and aggregating the large quantity of data that comes into Klaviyo.\n\n   Our data science team is still in it's early days, you'll be a founding member and expected to have a big impact on the direction and products we ship that help our customers learn and grow from their data.\n\nYou Will:\n\n     * Have a background in statistics and understand of different distributions and the conditions under which they're valid (e.g. when is independence necessary and how do you test for this).\n     * Have experience with machine learning algorithms such as regressions, decision trees, k-means clustering and neural nets.\n     * Understand Bayesian modeling techniques and how those influence the model building process.\n     * Have experience cleaning and normalizing data sets as well as create holdout data sets to test and validate models on.\n     * Have used data science packages to train and validate models. We use Python, so Pandas, NumPy and SciPy are all packages we're used to.\n     * Have demonstrated a measurable impact based on the models you've created. It's not always easy getting a model correct, we love talking about places we got stuck and work as a team to think through ideas that could unblock us.\n     * Not required, but it's a plus if you're comfortable with web frameworks (we use Django) to wrap models in APIs that can be consumed by other product teams or our customers directly. Our engineering team makes it easy to deploy and manage services.\n     * Not required, but it's a plus if you have experience with distributed algorithms for analyzing and modeling off of distributed data sets.\n\nYou Have:\n\n     * Bachelor's degree in computer science, applied mathematics, statistics or other relevant quantitative disciplines, or equivalent industry experience.\n     * Deep understanding of statistical distributions and linear algebra.\n     * Have worked in a data science role for 3+ years professionally or academically and can talk about the projects and techniques you used.\n     * Experience with Python and data science packages such as Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, etc.\n     * Experience with SQL and databases -- we use both SQL and \"NoSQL\" databases such as Cassandra.\n\n   About Us\n\n   Klaviyo is a team of people who are crazy motivated by growth.\n   It's what we help our customers do: grow their businesses by making it possible and easy for them to use their data to power better marketing.\n   It's how we behave as individuals: we're all deeply passionate about learning.\n   It's how we manage our business: we have thousands of paying customers, we're profitable, and we're growing insanely fast.\n   And it's what our culture is all about. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Nava is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign or\n   expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.\n   Disability status\n   [Select ..._______________________________________________]\n   Your name\n   ____________________\n   Today's date\n "title": "Nava - Growth Product Manager (DC, SF, NYC)", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/nava/d26bf11b-89f4-4bbd-b8fa-3defc08f20a8", "description": "   Nava is at the forefront of reimagining how our government serves its people, and we're looking for a Growth Product Manager to drive our vision forward. The Growth PM will focus primarily on growing Nava's impact and business through new product offerings, which can take the form of software-as-a-service (SaaS) products or professional services engagements. You'll work directly with Nava's leadership to create SaaS product strategy as we identify and enter new government market verticals, and lead our efforts to find product-market fit within those verticals in a way that's consistent with our mission.\n\n   You'll work with Nava's product managers and our team at large in leading product thinking at new professional services engagements. You'll conduct market research and competitive analysis using a mixture of public data, meetings and interviews, and trend analysis.\n\n   You're comfortable with an entrepreneurial approach to need-finding and high degrees of ambiguity, and adopt highly resourceful approaches to gather information and validate or invalidate hypotheses quickly. You're able to take both a top-down (market-first) analytical approach as well as a bottoms-up (needs-first) approach to product development.\n\nWhat you'll do\n\n     * Craft strategy and lead the product effort on small, rotating teams to discover, identify, and analyze market segments where Nava can deliver tangible public benefit in the form of a profitable SaaS solution\n     * Lead small cross-functional teams in Nava's discovery work to understand and win new contracts\n     * Drive the end-to-end process of market research, competitive analysis, and constraints research\n     * Rapidly prototype with engineering and design against user needs\n     * Lead the product process across its lifecycle, from prototyping to marketing and adoption\n     * Absorb, apply, and improve Nava's product strategy and contract evaluation frameworks\n     * Represent Nava's unique capabilities, expertise, approach, and values in meetings with new partners and potential partners\n     * Communicate internally about market learnings, new developments and trends, and possible opportunities\n\nWhat we're looking for\n\n     * At least three years of experience as a Product Manager of a cross-functional team\n     * Experience running and/or shipping consumer web applications\n     * Experience leading a team to find product-market fit within a problem space\n     * Ability to approach product strategy both top-down (market-first) and bottom-up (need-first) to identify attractive verticals\n     * Ability to generate very strong product plans and build buy-in across the team, our government partners, and other contractors\n     * Excellent written and verbal communication skills\n     * Ability to execute with incomplete information; great product instincts and an ability to create order from divergent needs\n     * Ability to define a product objective, and logically reverse engineer the path and communications to achieve the objective\n     * Ability to identify market trends and shifts that will affect product direction, and updating plans based on future expectations\n     * An adaptive, empathetic, collaborative, and positive mindset\n     * If located in San Francisco or New York, regular travel to DC is required\n\n   We're a small team working to radically improve our government, so everyone that joins us has a direct impact on the direction and success of Nava. We are stewards - we hold a deep responsibility towards the systems that we work with. We are a community - we value collaboration both within our teams and with the many hardworking people within government. All engineering teams at Netflix use the platform and build application and insights on it.\n\n   We are looking for an experienced, talented, and motivated Senior Software Engineer to join the Real Time Data Infrastructure team. "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/dab396d4-2f14-4796-aac0-0d82883dccf0", "description": "   A World-Changing Company\n\n   At Palantir, we're passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) understand our customers' greatest pain points and design end-to-end solutions to address them. FDSEs solicit constant feedback on their work from both customers and colleagues, improving our products over time with rapid iteration cycles.\n\n   FDSEs deploy ground breaking technical solutions to solve our customers' hardest problems. Projects often start with a nebulous question like \"Why are we losing customers?\" or \"How can we more effectively identify instances of money laundering?\" FDSEs lead the way in developing a solution, from high-level system design and prototyping to application development and data integration. As an FDSE, you leverage everything around you: Palantir products, open source technologies, and anything you and your team can build to drive real impact.\n\n   You work with customers around the globe, where you gain rare insight into the world's most important industries and institutions. We help our customers detect insider trading, improve disaster relief, fight healthcare fraud, and more. Each mission presents different challenges, from the regulatory environment to the nature of the data to the user population. You will work to accommodate all aspects of an environment to drive real technical outcomes for our customers.\n\nTechnologies We Use\n\n     * Core Palantir products provide the foundations for our deployments\n     * Custom applications built on top of core Palantir platforms\n     * Postgres, Cassandra, Hadoop, and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing\n     * Java and Groovy for our back-end applications and data integration tools\n     * Typescript, React, Leaflet, and d3 for our web technologies\n     * Python for data processing and analysis\n     * Palantir cloud infrastructure based on AWS EC2 and S3\n\nOur Principles\n\n     * Impact: We take on meaningful and challenging projects that change the world for the better.\n     * Dedication: We see projects through from beginning to end in spite of obstacles we may encounter.\n     * Collaboration: We work internally with people from a variety of backgrounds -- such as other FDSEs, product teams, and Deployment Strategists. We also work externally with our customers, often on site, to understand and solve their problems.\n     * Trust: We trust each other to effectively manage time and priorities--we don't micromanage. We want to give people the space to think for themselves.\n     * Growth: We push ourselves and our peers to improve themselves and the world around them.\n     * Learning: We often face entirely novel problems, where we need to pick up a lot of new information and learn how to use it to make progress.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.\n     * Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.\n     * Understanding of how technical decisions impact the user of what you're building.\n     * Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, or similar languages.\n     * Ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.\n     * Skill and comfort working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.\n     * Demonstrated ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. These products must handle messy data at scale, all while maintaining an intuitive user experience and a wide range of analytic capabilities.\n\nSome of the things our Software Engineers have done:\n\n     * Built a web-based mapping interface that handles millions of data points dynamically displayed at once.\n     * Constructed an analysis platform on top of a columnar database and custom infrastructure that allows complex numerical analysis at the petabyte scale.\n     * Built AtlasDB, which provides high-scale, reliable data storage for Palantir products. This NoSQL distributed data store adds a transactional layer that gives the whole system ACID properties.\n     * Developed a WYSIWYG web app for quickly creating interactive, data-driven web sites.\n     * Worked on a variety of Palantir open-source projects. Some of our favorites, available on our GitHub page, are Blueprint, Plottable, TSLint, and AtlasDB.\n\nTechnologies We Use\n\n     * A variety of languages including Java and Go for backend and Typescript for frontend.\n     * Open-source technologies like Cassandra, Spark, ElasticSearch, React, and Redux.\n     * Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, and Github.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * You are a strong coder--regardless of which language you use or how you learned it, we're looking for people who can write clean, effective code.\n     * You enjoy collaboration with others--our work isn't carried out in a vacuum, and everyone contributes to get the job done.\n     * You understand that making mistakes means you're learning, and you actively seek opportunities to grow and develop.\n     * You are passionate about creating intuitive and scalable products that magnify the analytical capabilities of our users.\n     * You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and constantly revising assumptions in response to new information.\n     * You want to work on software that is changing the world.\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.\n\n   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at (650) 473-9158.\n\n   Apply for this job\n", "utc_datetime": "2017-10-04T12:44:11.911149", "lat": 37.4418834, "lng": -122.1430195, "country": "United States", "employment_type": "Full-time", "remote_ok": "doesnt_say", "time_commitment": "Full-time"}{"key": "5b26197b391c5dab05c5606d43fba9c6", "title": "Palantir Technologies - Software Engineer, Site Reliability ...", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/40e6b701-9fea-4325-beab-72612ae0f21a", "description": "   A World-Changing Company\n\n   At Palantir, we're passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As an Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) you will work collaboratively with multiple internal product teams to build tools that ensure our software is performant and available to those who rely on it. SRE's combine engineering experience and a drive for technical improvement to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges. Our team strives to automate processes whenever possible, using whatever tools are best for the job. We treat operations issues as if they are software problems.\n\n   You come from a systems administration or software development background (but are comfortable in both areas). You are self-directed and have the ability to track solutions from design through implementation, owning every step along the way. And you won't be alone in this endeavor - our Engineers go to customer sites and work side by side with Palantir's implementation teams and customer IT departments to understand their unique problems and develop innovative solutions. Our goal is to strive for optimum performance of our core technologies and a commitment to best practice.\n\nSome of The Things Our Software Engineers Have Done\n\n     * Built configuration management solutions to manage Palantir deployments and services.\n     * Developed systems to detect and remediate known issues, to improve overall reliability of Palantir products and services.\n     * Built sophisticated monitoring systems to provide actionable intelligence.\n     * Optimized performance and tuning for critical services that back critical Palantir infrastructure.\n     * Improved the fault tolerance and disaster recovery of Palantir services.\n\nTechnologies We Use\n\n     * A variety of languages including Python, Java and Go\n     * Postgres, Cassandra, Hadoop and Spark for distributed data storage and parallel computing\n     * AWS, VMWare ESX, KVM, Xen, Docker and Kubernetes\n     * Puppet for Configuration Management\n     * Linux systems, CentOS and Red Hat\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.\n     * You are a strong coder -- we're looking for people who can write clean, effective code in Python, Ruby or a similar language.\n     * You have several years of Linux experience and are comfortable debugging systems performance issues.\n     * You enjoy collaboration with others--our work isn't carried out in a vacuum, and everyone contributes to get the job done. You have the ability to work effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals.\n     * You understand that making mistakes means you're learning, and you actively seek opportunities to grow and develop.\n     * You are passionate about creating intuitive and scalable products that magnify the analytical capabilities of our users.\n     * You are comfortable working in a fast-paced environment and constantly revising assumptions in response to new information.\n     * You are passionate about security and are always looking into ways to improve the security posture of systems and services\n     * You want to work on software that is changing the world.\n\n   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at +1 (650) 473-9158.\n\n   #LI-LB1\n\n   Apply for this job\n", "utc_datetime": "2017-10-04T12:44:23.984414", "lat": 51.5073509, "lng": -0.1277583, "country": "United Kingdom", "employment_type": "Full-time", "remote_ok": "doesnt_say", "time_commitment": "Full-time"}{"key": "5b26197b391c5dab05c5606d43fba9c6", "title": "Palantir Technologies - Software Engineer, New Grad", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/2ca052ad-c9f6-4892-aa32-7016b32a1686/apply", "description": "Submit your application\n\n     * Resume/CV *\n       ATTACH RESUME/CV                     \n       Couldn't auto-read resume.\n       Analyzing resume...\n       Success!\n       File exceeds the maximum upload size of 100MB. veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   At Palantir, protecting privacy and civil liberties is a core commitment. We do not believe that a Palantir product is successful if it cannot be used in a way that protects privacy and civil liberties. As more governments and industries demand our technology, we find ourselves operating in increasingly complex legal regimes and often facing novel privacy and civil liberties questions.\n\n   Palantir's Privacy and Civil Liberties Engineering team is a multi-disciplinary group of lawyers, philosophers, and engineers who look for engineering solutions to legal and policy challenges.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Problem solve and think creatively about solutions that mitigate privacy and civil liberties concerns, while still capturing the benefits of a new technology or data set.\n     * Use your strong communications skills that enable you to explain legal concepts to engineers and engineering concepts to lawyers in ways that everyone can understand.\n     * Have the opportunity to develop new technologies and policies that will be used by actual Palantir customers.\n\nExamples of past intern projects include:\n\n     * Developing a tool for dynamically applying data minimization transforms (hashing, character masking, generalization, etc.) to data returned by database queries.\n     * Implementing audit logging and audit analytics capabilities to support oversight and accountability.\n     * Building a web UI for complex data retention and deletion workflows that facilitate compliance with privacy and data protection regulations.\n     * Researching law and policy in countries around the world and advising customers on how to use Palantir's capabilities to facilitate compliance with those requirements.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * Advanced level Computer Science coursework, including in algorithms and data structures; experience with Java and/or web technologies a plus\n     * Must be planning to graduate in 2019\n     * Demonstrated interest in and understanding of privacy and civil liberties law and policy; conversant with PCL-related current events and legal developments\n     * Strong written and oral communications skills.\n     * Ability and desire to collaborate with others to craft practical solutions to legal, policy, and/or ethical challenges\n\n   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at (650) 473-9158.\n\n   Apply for this job\n", "utc_datetime": "2017-10-04T12:44:42.491052", "lat": 51.5073509, "lng": -0.1277583, "country": "United Kingdom", "employment_type": "Internship", "remote_ok": "doesnt_say", "time_commitment": "Internship"}{"key": "5b26197b391c5dab05c5606d43fba9c6", "title": "Palantir Technologies - Forward Deployed Software Engineer", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/2bd59430-e96e-45f7-9d56-ef28e9b15b86/apply", "description": "Submit your application\n\n     * Resume/CV *\n       ATTACH RESUME/CV                     \n       Couldn't auto-read resume.\n       Analyzing resume...\n       Success!\n       File exceeds the maximum upload size of 100MB. Equal Employment Opportunity information   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.\n\n   Palantir is a federal contractor or subcontractor subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil right laws and regulations. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, national origin, disability, military, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.\n\n   We invite all applicants to voluntarily self-identify their race, ethnicity, and gender. Submission of the information on this form is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. Information obtained will be retained in a confidential file and separate from personnel records. This information may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable federal laws, executive orders, and regulations. ...________________________________________________________]\n     * Hispanic or Latino\n       A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.\n     * White (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.\n     * Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.\n     * Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.\n     * American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.\n     * Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       All persons who identify with more than one of the above five races.\n of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. ...________________________________________________________]\n     * Hispanic or Latino\n       A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.\n     * White (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.\n     * Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.\n     * Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.\n     * American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.\n     * Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       All persons who identify with more than one of the above five races.\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. Equal Employment Opportunity information   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.\n\n   Palantir is a federal contractor or subcontractor subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil right laws and regulations. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, national origin, disability, military, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.\n\n   We invite all applicants to voluntarily self-identify their race, ethnicity, and gender. Submission of the information on this form is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. Information obtained will be retained in a confidential file and separate from personnel records. This information may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable federal laws, executive orders, and regulations. If you want more information about any of the sections, please check with a company representative.\n   Gender\n   [Select ...______________]\n   Race\n   [Select ...________________________________________________________]\n     * Hispanic or Latino\n       A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.\n     * White (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.\n     * Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.\n     * Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.\n     * American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.\n     * Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       All persons who identify with more than one of the above five races.\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. Equal Employment Opportunity information   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.\n\n   Palantir is a federal contractor or subcontractor subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil right laws and regulations. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, national origin, disability, military, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.\n\n   We invite all applicants to voluntarily self-identify their race, ethnicity, and gender. Information obtained will be retained in a confidential file and separate from personnel records. (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number.
