Equal Employment Opportunity information   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.\n\n   Palantir is a federal contractor or subcontractor subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil right laws and regulations. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, national origin, disability, military, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.\n\n   We invite all applicants to voluntarily self-identify their race, ethnicity, and gender. Submission of the information on this form is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. Information obtained will be retained in a confidential file and separate from personnel records. This information may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable federal laws, executive orders, and regulations. If you want more information about any of the sections, please check with a company representative.\n   Gender\n   [Select ...______________]\n   Race\n   [Select ...________________________________________________________]\n     * Hispanic or Latino\n       A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.\n     * White (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.\n     * Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.\n     * Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.\n     * American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.\n     * Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       All persons who identify with more than one of the above five races.\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. Equal Employment Opportunity information   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir provides equal employment and affirmative action opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability.\n\n   Palantir is a federal contractor or subcontractor subject to certain governmental recordkeeping and reporting requirements for the administration of civil right laws and regulations. Employment decisions are made on the basis of job-related criteria without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age, genetic information, national origin, disability, military, or veteran status, or any other classification protected by applicable law.\n\n   We invite all applicants to voluntarily self-identify their race, ethnicity, and gender. Submission of the information on this form is strictly voluntary and refusal to provide it will not subject you to any adverse treatment. Information obtained will be retained in a confidential file and separate from personnel records. This information may only be used in accordance with the provision of applicable federal laws, executive orders, and regulations. If you want more information about any of the sections, please check with a company representative.\n   Gender\n   [Select ...______________]\n   Race\n   [Select ...________________________________________________________]\n     * Hispanic or Latino\n       A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.\n     * White (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.\n     * Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.\n     * Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.\n     * Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent, including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.\n     * American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America), and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.\n     * Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino)\n       All persons who identify with more than one of the above five races.\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For more information about this form or the equal employment obligations of Federal contractors, visit the U.S. Department of Labor's Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs (OFCCP) website at www.dol.gov/ofccp.\n\n   PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. of veteran status   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Palantir is a Government contractor subject to the Section 4212 of the Vietnam Era Veterans' Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, as amended by the Jobs for Veterans Act of 2002, which requires Government contractors to take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment: (1) Disabled veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a campaign\n   or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). If you believe that you belong to any of the categories of protected veterans, please indicate by making the appropriate selection.\n   Veteran status\n   [Select ...__________________]\n     ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________\n\nSelf-identification of disability   (Completion is voluntary and will not subject you to adverse treatment)\n\n   Form CC-305 / OMB Control Number 1250-0005 / Expires 1/31/2020\n\nWhy are you being asked to complete this form?\n\n   Because we do business with the government, we must reach out to, hire, and provide equal opportunity to qualified people with disabilities. To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As an Application Security Engineer at Palantir, you are at forefront of a unique and novel threat environment, guaranteeing our solutions are available and secure at scale. You are passionate about security research and are motivated by both finding novel attacks and building a secure engineering organization.\n\n   As a member of the Information Security team, you'll work with software engineers to improve the security of Palantir products across the development lifecycle. You'll get to apply your breaker skills, pentesting Palantir's products, and sharpen your builder skills, working to automate security assessments and shape software architecture.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Perform deep-dive penetration tests of Palantir products.\n     * Plan, build and deploy infrastructure to help catch vulnerabilities automatically.\n     * Assist engineering teams in feature design, threat modeling, and security-critical code review.\n     * Coordinate external vendors providing 3rd party security reviews.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * Ability to communicate technical security concepts to diverse audiences, both verbally and in writing.\n     * Deep expertise with application test methodologies and tooling (eg. Burp).\n     * Strong familiarity with OWASP Top 10 web vulnerabilities and how to engineer software to avoid them.\n     * Working knowledge of at least one of Java, Golang, Python or Ruby.\n     * Experience applying static and/or dynamic analysis in application testing.\n     * Ability to evaluate cryptography choice and implementation.\n     * Passion for automating application security testing and the strengths/weaknesses of test automation.\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As an Infrastructure Quality Engineer (IQE), you are responsible for ensuring that we develop and deploy first-class products to customers around the world. It's your responsibility to ask, \"does the product solve the most pressing problem?\" and \"how do we ship the product more quickly and easily?\" To answer these questions, you will observe first-hand, the common issues encountered while deploying and using our software at our customer sites. You will then partner with various teams internally to generate innovative solutions and implement fixes.\n\n   You approach quality holistically, doing everything from performance benchmarking, automation, and debugging to release management, user research, paper prototyping, and feature testing. Your job is not to build the airplane -- it's to make sure all of the pieces fit together, that the ride is smooth, safe, and enjoyable for everyone on board, and that the plane stays in the air (which we think is pretty important).\n\nSome of the things IQEs have done in the past year include:\n\n     * Rebuild a production system to improve performance and scale by an order of magnitude.\n     * Advise on the best architecture for new products.\n     * Run weekly releases for customer's production systems.\n     * Respond to, debugging, and fixing exigent issues for customers globally.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Drive software architecture discussions and decisions.\n     * Write automation code and develop automation frameworks.\n     * Participate in every stage of the product life cycle.\n     * Design and execute test cases using functional requirements.\n     * Find, understand, and debug product issues.\n     * Work with Software Developers, Product Designers, Forward Deployed Software Engineers, Product Managers, and others to ship high quality releases.\n     * Embed with our customer-facing teams to understand the issues that they face deploying and using our products.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * BS in Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or comparable experience.\n     * Ability to thrive and create order in a fast-moving, unstructured environment.\n     * Excellent teamwork, independent decision making, and communication skills.\n     * Analytical thinking, creative problem-solving skills and great attention to detail.\n     * Experience working with complex systems (software, biological, mechanical, etc.) and the desire and ability to understand them in detail.\n     * Scripting abilities, experience working in Java, C++, C, Go, Scala, Python, Bash, or Javascript, or the ability to learn these skills.\n     * Understanding of testing methodologies, preferably backend and scale testing.\n\n   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at +1 (650) 473-9158.\n\n   Apply for this job\n", "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/e6fcc84b-af56-4d4e-b7b4-151eaf71e480", "description": "   A World-Changing Company\n\n   At Palantir, we're passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As an Infrastructure Quality Engineer (IQE), you are responsible for ensuring that we develop and deploy first-class products to customers around the world. It's your responsibility to ask, \"does the product solve the most pressing problem?\" and \"how do we ship the product more quickly and easily?\" To answer these questions, you will observe first-hand, the common issues encountered while deploying and using our software at our customer sites. You will then partner with various teams internally to generate innovative solutions and implement fixes.\n\n   You approach quality holistically, doing everything from performance benchmarking, automation, and debugging to release management, user research, paper prototyping, and feature testing. Your job is not to build the airplane -- it's to make sure all of the pieces fit together, that the ride is smooth, safe, and enjoyable for everyone on board, and that the plane stays in the air (which we think is pretty important).\n\nSome of the things IQEs have done in the past year include:\n\n     * Rebuild a production system to improve performance and scale by an order of magnitude.\n     * Advise on the best architecture for new products.\n     * Run weekly releases for customer's production systems.\n     * Respond to, debugging, and fixing exigent issues for customers globally.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Drive software architecture discussions and decisions.\n     * Write automation code and develop automation frameworks.\n     * Participate in every stage of the product life cycle.\n     * Design and execute test cases using functional requirements.\n     * Find, understand, and debug product issues.\n     * Work with Software Developers, Product Designers, Forward Deployed Software Engineers, Product Managers, and others to ship high quality releases.\n     * Embed with our customer-facing teams to understand the issues that they face deploying and using our products.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * BS in Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Physics, or comparable experience.\n     * Ability to thrive and create order in a fast-moving, unstructured environment.\n     * Excellent teamwork, independent decision making, and communication skills.\n     * Analytical thinking, creative problem-solving skills and great attention to detail.\n     * Experience working with complex systems (software, biological, mechanical, etc.) and the desire and ability to understand them in detail.\n     * Scripting abilities, experience working in Java, C++, C, Go, Scala, Python, Bash, or Javascript, or the ability to learn these skills.\n     * Understanding of testing methodologies, preferably backend and scale testing.\n\n   If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations@palantir.com or you may call us at +1 (650) 473-9158.\n\n   Apply for this job\n", World-Changing Company\n\n   At Palantir, we're passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   Palantir software is deployed at the world's most critical institutions to help them solve their greatest challenges. Users at customer sites from Washington DC, to London, to Tokyo rely on Palantir's high availability to pursue their missions. Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) make sure our expanding number of customer deployments run smoothly 24 hours a day.\n\n   As an SRE, you will monitor and maintain Palantir systems to pre-empt problems before they ever threaten our customers' workflows. You will combine engineering experience and a commitment to improve existing systems and processes with the creativity to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges.\n\n   Our team strives to automate processes wherever possible, using whatever tools are best for the job. Our responsibilities range from architecting systems for new implementations of Palantir, administering co-located servers (including hardware troubleshooting) to maintaining database platforms.\n\n   We work with a variety of teams to understand threats to our software and improve our products over time. We work side by side with Palantir's implementation teams and our customers' IT departments to understand their business's unique problems and to develop innovative solutions. We document our successes and communicate them back to Palantir's product teams to advance the way our hardware, software, and network solutions are deployed to minimize failure rates and increase overall system reliability.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * Experience with Linux system administration (RHEL or CentOS preferred)\n     * Good scripting ability in Bash, and preferably also Python, Ruby, Perl or JavaScript\n     * Experience with monitoring systems using tools like Nagios and writing health checks\n     * Practical experience managing databases or search engines, such as Postgres, MySQL, Oracle, Cassandra or ElasticSearch\n     * Ability to debug performance problems in complex distributed systems\n     * Interest in learning and utilizing newer technologies like Spark, Hadoop, Cassandra, and ElasticSearch\n     * Ability to work independently with minimal supervision\n     * Ability to participate in a 24/7 on-call rotation\n     * Unwavering commitment to operational security and best practices\n\nPreferred\n\n     * BS/MS in Computer Science\n     * Experience with system management tools like Puppet, Chef or Ansible\n     * Knowledge of server hardware and/or experience working with Amazon Web Services (AWS)\n     * Familiarity with information security standards and best practices\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. "Palantir Technologies - DevOps Engineer", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/palantir/f37e47b0-0eed-4c8d-9d9c-0ae55ad432a8", "description": "   A World-Changing Company\n\n   At Palantir, we're passionate about building software that solves problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As a DevOps engineer, you will be joining a team of enthusiastic engineers set out to build tools and applications to keep Palantir running smoothly, reliably, and efficiently. We do everything from running the development pipelines to deploying self-service container schedulers for various company workloads. Given the breadth of the work that we do, learning and growth is a primary goal for all DevOps Engineers.\n\n   On any given day, you could be improving the stability and scalability of our systems, driving adoption of best practices, and developing new solutions to new problems. Our team operates at close to a 1:100 ratio with our users, which means that we're very dedicated on finding the best solution (including open sourced and managed solutions) and automating every process along the way.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Develop our system management tool offerings by using an agile, iterative method, and get feedback directly from users to create the best working environment in the industry.\n     * Research, evaluate, develop, and deploy new tools to improve user efficiency. This includes tools that make deploying code easy for devs, as well as tools that make it easy for users to build their own virtual machines, making your solutions the most compelling to use.\n     * Deploy highly available, scalable, maintainable, monitored systems and services using infrastructure-as-code frameworks.\n     * Lead the adoption of tooling and industry best practices by means of advocacy and outreach to help our development teams level up.\n     * Use Bash, Go, Python, Java, or whatever tools are at your disposal to automate lifecycle management: deployment, information security posture, maintenance, and inventory.\n\nWhat We Value\n\n     * B.S./M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, Math, Physics, or equivalent experience.\n     * 4+ years experience working in Developer Operations.\n     * Experience working with AWS or another cloud provider.\n     * Experience with managing and developing on highly-available and distributed software.\n     * Proficiency in a language such as Java, Python, or Go.\n     * Comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives.\n     * Ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.\n     * Exposure to infrastructure-as-code frameworks like Terraform and Cloudformation and modern web frameworks like React.\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.\n\n   The Role\n\n   As a Procurement Operations Analyst, you ensure that our engineers have every tool they need to crack some of the most challenging and puzzling problems on the planet. You do this by owning the full-stack operations of how something gets purchased, paid, and deployed so our engineers have everything they need to make the world a safer place. As our company continues to grow, we are constantly thinking about how to improve and automate the procure-to-pay process so we can continue providing amazing outcomes in even more places across the world.\n\nIn this role, you will:\n\n     * Help build the end-to-end procure-to-pay process.\n     * Manage the purchasing funnel across Palantir, including supplier selection and negotiations, catalog management, and order execution.\n     * Coordinate with business teams to identify and forecast needs.\n     * Assist the Accounts Payable team in the processing of supplier invoices.\n     * Maintain accurate order and inventory balances, globally.\n     * Help automate the invoicing and vendor onboarding process.\n     * Implement additional infrastructure where necessary to support global operations.\n\nWhat We Value:\n\n     * Bachelor's in Finance or Accounting, or equivalent work experience\n     * 3+ years working in accounts payable, procurement, and/or supply chain, preferred\n     * Understanding of full-cycle accounts payable and procure-to-pay\n     * Knowledge of fundamental accounting related to procurement and accounts payable\n     * Highly autonomous -- find problems and solve them\n     * Strong organization skills, attention to detail, and highly accountable\n     * Strong interpersonal and professional communication skills\n     * Ability to prioritize and work in a deadline-sensitive and customer service-oriented environment\n     * Experience with Excel, Word, and Outlook (SQL is a plus)\n\n   Palantir is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Compensation includes full-time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits including healthcare, commuter benefits, parental leave, and an unlimited vacation policy.\n\n   About Udemy Engineering\n    Do you love what you do?  Are you passionate about programming?  If you love challenges and strive for excellence, come build the future of learning with us!  We are a small, collaborative, fun group of engineers looking for someone like you to become part of our team.  Our user facing projects are diverse, interesting, and innovative.  Our work is impactful; we help people improve their lives through learning.  We leverage the latest technologies (Python, Django, React, Redis, RabbitMQ), adopt industry best practices and iterate in fast-paced release environment.  You will see the positive results of your work weekly.  We don't forget to celebrate and have fun.  Come and grow with us!\n\nResponsibilities:\n\n     * Design, develop, test, and release features for Udemy's user facing products that are crucial for business expansion and growth.\n     * Collaborate with product managers, designers and engineers to identify opportunities and implement solutions that provide positive value to our students and our business.\n     * Plan, organize, and complete work within agile sprints.  Communicate effectively on progress and meeting expectations.\n     * Participate in code reviews, design discussions, and develop features and solutions that scale.\n     * Serve as a technical lead for various projects/tasks as needed.\n     * Use best software development practices and processes to coach and mentor junior engineers to become proficient developers.\n     * Contribute to a team culture that values openness, quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering innovation.\n     * Identify and evaluate new technologies that improve performance, maintainability and elegance of our software implementation.\n\nQualifications:\n\n     * Minimum four (4) years of experience as a full-stack software engineer.\n     * Object Oriented software design patterns and computer science fundamentals (e.g. data structures, algorithms).\n     * Web application development using modern framework.\n     * Web Framework ORMs (e.g. Django, Rails, Zend, etc.)\n     * Python or other scripting languages such as Ruby, PHP (minimum 2 years), etc.\n     * Relational DB (e.g. MySQL) including development of complex SQL queries\n     * Front-end development with JavaScript using modern JS libraries/frameworks. (e.g. React, Angular, JQuery, etc.)\n     * Linux and/or Unix\n     * Real-time messaging and NoSQL infrastructures: Redis, RabbitMQ, Celery\n     * Testing methods, including unit and integration tests\n     * Ability to learn and work with existing code bases, up and down the software stack.\n     * Willingness to \"go the extra mile\" when needed.\n\nPreferred but not required:\n\n     * Contribution to open source projects\n     * Public speaking or technical blog skills\n\n   Udemy in the News:\n   Fortune: Naspers Just Invested $60 Million In This Online Education Startup\n   Forbes: Learn At Work From Gary Vee, Seth Godin and Guy Kawasaki\n   USA Today: Tech jobs are thriving nationwide -- up to 7.3M\n   Entrepreneur: Workplace Stress Is at a Record High. We also celebrate our milestones and support each other every day.\n   Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and headquartered in San Francisco's SOMA neighborhood with offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey.\n\n   JOB DESCRIPTION\n   Build a versatile Search system that matches students with right courses.\n   Build robust and scalable software systems to support high traffic website.\n   While having expertise in specific areas, the job may require enhancing code up and down the software stack\n   Function as a technical lead for various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities\n   Practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.\n   Mentor junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes\n   Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.\n   Continue to research and evaluate new technologies that may improve performance and elegance of our software implementation\n\nQualifications:\n\n     * Exceptional coding skills\n     * Ability to solve time-critical problems\n     * Strong technical communication skills\n     * Solid knowledge of:\n     * OO Modelling\n     * Scalable data design\n     * REST architecture\n     * Experience with:\n     * Python, Django  or Java\n     * MySQL, PostgreSQL\n     * Solr or Elasticsearch is a big plus\n\nTechnologies currently in use:\n\n     * Python, Django\n     * REST architecture\n     * Elasticsearch\n     * Java\n     * Javascript, JQuery, AngularJS, ReactJs\n     * MySQL, Redis\n     * Jenkins, Selenium\n     * Git, Github\n     * Datadog\n     * Ansible\n     * Apache, Nginx\n\n   Udemy in the News:\n   Fortune: Naspers Just Invested $60 Million In This Online Education Startup\n\n   Forbes: Learn At Work From Gary Vee, Seth Godin and Guy Kawasaki\n\n   USA Today: Tech jobs are thriving nationwide -- up to 7.3M\n\n   Entrepreneur: Workplace Stress Is at a Record High. In a single day, you might need to understand the details of an authentication protocol (e.g. SAML), help a customer debug the effects of a corporate web proxy, and then later meet with HR business leaders to explain Udemy's ability to integrate into their business process.\n\n   The role reports into Udemy's Engineering organization, with tight ties to Customer Success, and is based in San Francisco. It requires some infrequent travel as well as some flexibility to overlap with business hours of our customers. Given the diversity of job responsibilities, we expect the person in this role to revel in learning quickly \"on the job\", picking up what is needed to get the job done.\n\nResponsibilities:\n\n     * Serve as a main technical contact for Udemy for Business prospects and customers, providing a first level of technical support when needed.\n     * Lead, manage, and support prospects and customers through integration and implementation of Udemy for Business features, including SSO, API integrations, analytics, and reporting.\n     * Respond to technical RFPs.\n     * Provide and publish sample code for Udemy APIs, including customer-facing documentation.\n     * Quickly build working prototypes to show off product features or functions.\n     * Feed customer conversations, ideas, concerns and the like back into our product management (PM) and development teams.\n     * Document Udemy's security policies and explain Udemy's security posture to prospective customer technical teams.\n     * Develop tools to automate or simplify your work.\n\nQualifications:\n\n     * 18 months or more of professional experience in a software engineering role.\n     * Ability to gain the trust of customers, understand their business interests, speak their language, and understand their concerns.\n     * General knowledge of software development and deployment practices.\n     * Experience building and debugging web applications and APIs.\n     * Comfort with Windows, Unix/Linux, and OS X environments as well as git and github.\n\nNice to Have:\n\n     * Hands-on experience with Single Sign-on (SSO) technologies, SAML, Active Directory, LDAP, OAuth 2, and services like PingOne, OneLogin, OKTA, and so on.\n     * Understanding of enterprise security and compliance requirements.\n     * Past experience as a sales engineer, technical product manager or technical writer.\n     * Ability to translate customer requests and input into meaningful product features.\n       Experience with:\n     * Python (including Django), modern JS frameworks (Angular, React)\n     * Enterprise cloud providers\n     * Reporting tools like Tableau, QlikView, Crystal Reports\n     * Publically available code (github repos), blog posts, or the like, as well as contributions to open source.\n\n   ABOUT UDEMY for BUSINESS\n   Udemy for Business consumerizes the learning experience at work through an engaging and intuitive interface, that is integrated with Udemy's core marketplace. Built for businesses striving to be at the forefront of innovation, Udemy for Business offers fresh, relevant on-demand learning. Employees can access over 2000+ high-quality courses taught by the world's leading experts on a variety of key topics ranging from development and IT to leadership, design and stress management. In addition to its curated content collection, organizations can also securely host and distribute their own proprietary content.\n\n   Leading organizations including PayPal, Lyft, Booking.com, Capgemini, ON24, and Century 21 choose Udemy for Business to upskill their workforce and drive learning forward.\n\n   UDEMY IN THE NEWS\n   Fortune: Naspers Just Invested $60 Million In This Online Education Startup\n   Forbes: Learn At Work From Gary Vee, Seth Godin and Guy Kawasaki\n   USA Today: Tech jobs are thriving nationwide -- up to 7.3M\n   Entrepreneur: Workplace Stress Is at a Record High. We also celebrate our milestones and support each other every day.\n\n   Founded in 2010, Udemy is privately owned and headquartered in San Francisco's SOMA neighborhood with offices in Dublin, Ireland, and Ankara, Turkey. Compensation includes full-time salary, equity compensation plan, and competitive benefits including healthcare, commuter benefits, parental leave, and an unlimited vacation policy.\n\n   Job Description:\n   Udemy is looking for a multi-talented individual with excellent communication and organization skills, knowledge and comfort with software development practices and techniques, and a passion to help businesses and other organizations become modern \"learning organizations\", via Udemy for Business.\n\n   This role is technical and customer facing, requiring a diverse set of skills, including those of a software developer, professional service provider, technical salesperson, and technical writer. In a single day, you might need to understand the details of an authentication protocol (e.g. SAML), help a customer debug the effects of a corporate web proxy, and then later meet with HR business leaders to explain Udemy's ability to integrate into their business process.\n\n   The role reports into Udemy's Engineering organization, with tight ties to Customer Success, and is based in San Francisco. It requires some infrequent travel as well as some flexibility to overlap with business hours of our customers. Given the diversity of job responsibilities, we expect the person in this role to revel in learning quickly \"on the job\", picking up what is needed to get the job done.\n\nResponsibilities:\n\n     * Serve as a main technical contact for Udemy for Business prospects and customers, providing a first level of technical support when needed.\n     * Lead, manage, and support prospects and customers through integration and implementation of Udemy for Business features, including SSO, API integrations, analytics, and reporting.\n     * Respond to technical RFPs.\n     * Provide and publish sample code for Udemy APIs, including customer-facing documentation.\n     * Quickly build working prototypes to show off product features or functions.\n     * Feed customer conversations, ideas, concerns and the like back into our product management (PM) and development teams.\n     * Document Udemy's security policies and explain Udemy's security posture to prospective customer technical teams.\n     * Develop tools to automate or simplify your work.\n\nQualifications:\n\n     * 18 months or more of professional experience in a software engineering role.\n     * Ability to gain the trust of customers, understand their business interests, speak their language, and understand their concerns.\n     * General knowledge of software development and deployment practices.\n     * Experience building and debugging web applications and APIs.\n     * Comfort with Windows, Unix/Linux, and OS X environments as well as git and github.\n\nNice to Have:\n\n     * Hands-on experience with Single Sign-on (SSO) technologies, SAML, Active Directory, LDAP, OAuth 2, and services like PingOne, OneLogin, OKTA, and so on.\n     * Understanding of enterprise security and compliance requirements.\n     * Past experience as a sales engineer, technical product manager or technical writer.\n     * Ability to translate customer requests and input into meaningful product features.\n       Experience with:\n     * Python (including Django), modern JS frameworks (Angular, React)\n     * Enterprise cloud providers\n     * Reporting tools like Tableau, QlikView, Crystal Reports\n     * Publically available code (github repos), blog posts, or the like, as well as contributions to open source.\n\n   ABOUT UDEMY for BUSINESS\n   Udemy for Business consumerizes the learning experience at work through an engaging and intuitive interface, that is integrated with Udemy's core marketplace. Built for businesses striving to be at the forefront of innovation, Udemy for Business offers fresh, relevant on-demand learning. Employees can access over 2000+ high-quality courses taught by the world's leading experts on a variety of key topics ranging from development and IT to leadership, design and stress management. In addition to its curated content collection, organizations can also securely host and distribute their own proprietary content.\n\n   Leading organizations including PayPal, Lyft, Booking.com, Capgemini, ON24, and Century 21 choose Udemy for Business to upskill their workforce and drive learning forward.\n\n   UDEMY IN THE NEWS\n   Fortune: Naspers Just Invested $60 Million In This Online Education Startup\n   Forbes: Learn At Work From Gary Vee, Seth Godin and Guy Kawasaki\n   USA Today: Tech jobs are thriving nationwide -- up to 7.3M\n   Entrepreneur: Workplace Stress Is at a Record High. improve and grow the Affirm Anywhere app.\n\n   The team you'll join is responsible for new product initiatives at Affirm that go beyond our core business in the value they provide to our customers. Part of this mandate is to invest in the Affirm Anywhere offering which provides powerful search and discovery tools that let customers find relevant themes, categories, merchants and discounts where they can save money and use Affirm financing. The team's work is a critical part of Affirm's mission to become a trusted financial partner for our customers, and to help them live their best and most fulfilling financial lives. You can think of the team as R&D or a \"startup within a startup\" working on the next generation of Affirm products.\n\nWhat You'll Do\n\n     * Lead technical projects from specification and planning, through execution & coding with multiple engineers, to testing and deployment into production\n     * Design and implement new product features, as well as extend core platform services and APIs to support those features\n     * Architect and build the web frontend for our Affirm Anywhere offering\n     * Analyze/debug performance issues on the frontend and across distributed services\n     * Plan, design, and build our core platform software and systems to scale with an increasing number of users, features, business requirements, partners, and new engineers\n     * Provide mentoring to more junior engineers in their progress on business and personal career goals\n\nWhat We Look For\n\n     * Passion and drive to change consumer finance for the better\n     * Experience building real-time distributed web services in the Consumer or SaaS space\n     * Ability to pick up new technologies quickly\n     * Strong software engineering fundamentals are far more important than familiarity with specific tools or languages\n     * Emphasis on writing clear, readable, testable code\n\nNice to have\n\n     * Experience working on growth hacking projects\n     * Interest in or experience with recommendation systems\n     * Python expertise\n\n   ABOUT AFFIRM\n   At Affirm we are using technology to re-imagine and re-build core parts of financial infrastructure to enable cheaper, friendlier and more transparent financial products and services that improve lives.\n\n   We believe the financial industry is fundamentally broken. We have started off by providing point-of-sale financing to our merchant's customers. We are continuously working on making our product available to more users, ensuring each customer interaction exceeds their expectations and being a great partner to our merchants.\n\n   We're looking for an experienced, motivated Engineering Manager to lead a product-facing full stack engineering team that will help us grow orders of magnitude larger from where we are now (1M+ loans, 1000+ merchants, 250+ employees as of June 2017). This team is critical to unlocking new business areas and strengthening Affirm's existing presence, and thereby accelerating the growth of our business.\n\n   In this role, you will be at the intersection of two significant industries: retail and finance. You will learn how to design and build reliable, scalable products and businesses in these industries, while catering to the needs of merchants.\n\nWhat You'll Do\n\n     * Lead, manage and scale a full stack engineering team from the current size of 4 engineers\n     * Collaborate with Product Management, Design, and other teams to define and deliver on the product and technical roadmap\n     * Establish a collaborative work environment that fosters autonomy, transparency, high degree of craftsmanship and personal growth.\n     * Evangelize software development best practices and set a high bar for other engineers to meet\n     * Lead technical discussions and plans to improve our overall software quality\n     * Plan, design, communicate and implement reliable, scalable and extensible software systems\n\nWhat We Look For\n\n     * Driven to change consumer banking for the better\n     * Prior experience leading a product-focused engineering team\n     * Prior management experience is a plus\n     * Fluent in full-stack development (we use React/Redux + Python/Flask)\n     * Prior experience architecting, building, launching and maintaining complex products\n     * Detail-oriented when it comes to user experience\n     * Strong cross-team communication and collaboration\n\n   Apply for this job\n", "utc_datetime": "2017-10-04T12:59:40.239114", "lat": 37.7749295, "lng": -122.4194155, "country": "United States", "employment_type": "Full-Time", "remote_ok": "doesnt_say", "time_commitment": "Full-Time"}{"key": "5b26197b391c5dab05c5606d43fba9c6", "title": "Skurt - Software Engineer (Product)", "website": "https://jobs.lever.co/skurt/3c6bf4ff-b40d-4c1a-945b-962701031395/apply", "description": "Submit your application\n\n     * Resume/CV *\n       ATTACH RESUME/CV                     \n       Couldn't auto-read resume.\n       Analyzing resume...\n       Success!\n       File exceeds the maximum upload size of 100MB. veterans - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military and is entitled to disability compensation (or who but for the receipt of military retired pay would be entitled to disability compensation) under laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, or was discharged or released from active duty because of a service-connected disability; (2) Recently separated veteran - A veteran separated during the three-year period beginning on the date of the veteran's discharge or release from active duty in the U.S military, ground, naval, or air service; (3) Active duty wartime or campaign badge veteran - A veteran who served on active duty in the U.S. military during a war, or in a\n   campaign or expedition for which a campaign badge was authorized under the laws administered by the Department of Defense; (4) Armed forces service medal veteran - A veteran who, while serving on active duty in the U.S. military ground, naval, or air service, participated in a United States military operation for which an Armed Forces service medal was awarded pursuant to Executive Order 12985 (61 Fed. Reg. 1209). To help us measure how well we are doing, we are asking you to tell us if you have a disability or if you ever had a disability. Completing this form is voluntary, but we hope that you will choose to fill it out. If you are applying for a job, any answer you give will be kept private and will not be used against you in any way.\n\n   If you already work for us, your answer will not be used against you in any way. Because a person may become disabled at any time, we are required to ask all of our employees to update their information every five years. You may voluntarily self-identify as having a disability on this form without fear of any punishment because you did not identify as having a disability earlier.\n\nHow do I know if I have a disability?\n\n   You are considered to have a disability if you have a physical or mental impairment or medical condition that substantially limits a major life activity, or if you have a history or record of such an impairment or medical condition. Disabilities include, but are not limited to:\n     * Blindness\n     * Deafness\n     * Cancer\n     * Diabetes\n     * Epilepsy\n     * Autism\n     * Cerebral palsy\n     * HIV/AIDS\n     * Schizophrenia\n     * Muscular dystrophy\n     * Bipolar disorder\n     * Major depression\n     * Multiple sclerosis (MS)\n     * Missing limbs or partially missing limbs\n     * Post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD)\n     * Obsessive compulsive disorder\n     * Impairments requiring the use of a wheelchair\n     * Intellectual disability (previously called mental retardation)\n\nReasonable Accommodation Notice\n\n   Federal law requires employers to provide reasonable accommodation to qualified individuals with disabilities. Please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job or to perform your job. Examples of reasonable accommodation include making a change to the application process or work procedures, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment.\n\n   Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended.
